## Primary Purpose
Base classes and data structures for pip's dependency resolution using resolvelib. Defines core abstractions for requirements, candidates, and constraints that form the foundation of the dependency resolver.

## Key Components

### Type Aliases & Utilities
- `CandidateLookup` (L12): Type alias for tuple containing optional Candidate and InstallRequirement
- `format_name()` (L15-19): Formats package names with extras (e.g., "package[extra1,extra2]")

### Core Data Structures
- `Constraint` (L22-58): Frozen dataclass representing version/hash/link constraints
  - Fields: `specifier` (version constraints), `hashes` (integrity hashes), `links` (URL constraints)
  - `empty()` classmethod (L28-30): Creates empty constraint
  - `from_ireq()` classmethod (L33-35): Builds constraint from InstallRequirement
  - `__bool__()` (L37-38): Returns True if any constraints exist
  - `__and__()` (L40-48): Merges constraint with InstallRequirement
  - `is_satisfied_by()` (L50-57): Checks if candidate satisfies all constraints

### Abstract Base Classes
- `Requirement` (L60-88): Abstract base for dependency requirements
  - Properties: `project_name` (L61-69), `name` (L72-78) - distinguishes base name from name with extras
  - Methods: `is_satisfied_by()` (L80-81), `get_candidate_lookup()` (L83-84), `format_for_error()` (L86-87)

- `Candidate` (L96-139): Abstract base for installable package candidates
  - Properties: `project_name` (L97-105), `name` (L107-114), `version` (L116-118), `is_installed` (L120-122), `is_editable` (L124-126), `source_link` (L128-130)
  - Methods: `iter_dependencies()` (L132-133), `get_install_requirement()` (L135-136), `format_for_error()` (L138-139)

### Helper Functions
- `_match_link()` (L90-93): Compares links for equivalence using candidate's source_link

## Key Dependencies
- `pip._vendor.packaging`: Version, specifier, and name handling
- `pip._internal.models.link`: Link objects and equivalence checking
- `pip._internal.req.req_install`: InstallRequirement integration
- `pip._internal.utils.hashes`: Hash validation

## Architectural Patterns
- Uses abstract base classes with NotImplementedError for interface definition
- Frozen dataclass for immutable constraint representation
- Type hints throughout for better IDE/tooling support
- Separation of project name (base) vs. name (with extras) concepts
- Factory methods (`empty()`, `from_ireq()`) for constraint creation
